context: Fortinet has a market share of 5.28% in the networking hardware market. Around the world in 2025, over 23,623 companies use Fortinet as a networking hardware tool, with 6,586 customers from the United States representing 44.92% of Fortinet's customer base. The company is known for its FortiGate NGFW platform and comprehensive security fabric approach. The 2025 network security market is shifting toward cloud-focused and SASE solutions, creating both opportunities and challenges for traditional hardware-focused vendors.

competitors.name: Cisco
competitors.notes: Largest competitor with 30.64% market share in networking hardware, plus Cisco Switches (10.78%) and Cisco Routers (8.92%). Best for extensive range of high-performance security products and seamless integration with existing network infrastructure. Dominates enterprise and service provider markets.

competitors.name: Palo Alto Networks
competitors.notes: Known for advanced cloud security and integrated threat prevention with cloud-first approach. One of the top Fortinet competitors in next-generation firewall space. Competes strongly in enterprise network security and cloud security platforms.

competitors.name: Check Point
competitors.notes: Known for unified security management with advanced threat prevention and protection across multiple layers. Solid alternative offering comprehensive network security features and strong enterprise presence.

competitors.name: Sophos
competitors.notes: Best for simplified, centralized management with strong endpoint protection and synchronized security features. Top alternative for organizations seeking user-friendly deployment and integrated security.

competitors.name: Juniper Networks
competitors.notes: Best for high-performance, scalable security solutions with advanced threat prevention and integration with networking products. Strong in service provider and large enterprise segments.

competitors.name: SonicWall
competitors.notes: Best for comprehensive network security features with user-friendly deployment and management. Popular in SMB and mid-market segments for cost-effective security solutions.

competitors.name: WatchGuard
competitors.notes: Best for simplified, multi-layered security with integrated UTM services ideal for small and medium-sized businesses. Focuses on ease of use and comprehensive protection for SMB market.

competitors.name: Barracuda
competitors.notes: Best for affordable, easy-to-use security solutions with strong email protection and backup capabilities. Competes in mid-market with integrated security and data protection.

competitors.name: Zscaler
competitors.notes: Cloud-native security option representing the shift to cloud-delivered security services. Competes in the SASE and cloud security space as alternative to traditional hardware-based approaches.

competitors.name: Cloudflare Zero Trust
competitors.notes: Cloud-native security platform competing in zero trust and edge security. Represents modern approach to network security without traditional hardware dependencies.
